Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2020/0315 b) Date of Occurrence: 27/11/2023
c) Installation Details: Minotaur Heavy - AC-9537-933 at
Training Center Alpha
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Pneumatic b) Date Component 06/12/2023
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Pneumatic Starter d) Main Assembly: Station-1 Starboard
e) Nomenclature: Pneumatic Starter Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: Modified
g) Part No.: PN-1242-X2 h) Sl No.: SN-3464-142
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 05/02/2020 l) Date of Removal: 04/12/2023
Pg No: 148 Ln No: 17 Pg No: 9 Ln No: 14
m) Manufacturing Agency: Stellar Avionics Ltd n) Date, Month & Year July 2017
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: Yes p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 4113 Hrs / 1795 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Major
b) Defect Observed: Pneumatic starter motor overheat. Defect found during scheduled maintenance.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Improper calibration during last maintenance cycle
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Pneumatic Starter component. Testing
confirmed performance below acceptable limits.
c) Remedial Measures Update software to latest certified version with bug fixes
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Issue technical bulletin to all operators
d) Attributable Code: D - Due to features inherent in the design
Remarks: Complete defect analysis performed. Lessons learned documented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Investigation findings reviewed. Root cause analysis is acceptable. Recommend implementation of proposed corrective actions.
Date: 18/12/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Dr. P.L. Mehta

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Component inspection records verified. All quality parameters were within acceptable limits during manufacturing.
Date: 19/12/2023 Signature: Wg Cdr M.S. Reddy
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Fleet experience reviewed. Similar occurrences noted on other platforms. Support fleet-wide inspection.
Date: 19/12/2023 Signature: Gp Capt N.R. Kumar
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Quality oversight review completed. Recommend monitoring effectiveness of implemented preventive actions.
Date: 22/12/2023 Signature: Wg Cdr D.S. Nair
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Design authority review completed. Recommend continued airworthiness monitoring of affected component type.
Date: 27/12/2023 Signature: Wg Cdr M.S. Reddy
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
